textCN: 除了期待天空一直不會下雨，你還可以學會在雨天跳舞。
textEN: Instead of wishing for the sky to never rain, you can learn to dance in the rain.

textCN: 人生所有的點都是連結在一起的。
textEN: Every point in life is connected.

textCN: 向前看，過去讓它過去。
textEN: Look forward — let bygones be bygones.

textCN: 每件事情發生都有它的原因。
textEN: Everything that happens has its own meaning.

textCN: 時間是人際關係的衡量標準之一。
textEN: Time is one of the standards by which relationships are measured.

textCN: 生命有限，可以偶爾浪費，但不要完全浪費。
textEN: Life is limited — you may waste a little of it sometimes, but don't waste it entirely.

textCN: 相遇即是一種緣分，珍惜出現在你生命裡的人。
textEN: Every encounter is a kind of fate — cherish the people who appear in your life.

textCN: 人生也許就該像蘇軾一樣，也無風雨也無晴。
textEN: Perhaps life, like Su Shi wrote, is neither stormy nor sunny.

textCN: 破鏡無法重圓，對待與他人的關係請小心輕放。
textEN: A broken mirror can't be mended — handle your relationships with care.

textCN: 你最該認識且了解的人，是你自己。
textEN: The person you should know and understand the most is yourself.

textCN: 自己選擇的路，不一定要跪著走，也可以站起來走，或者換個舒服的方式走。
textEN: The path you chose doesn't have to be walked on your knees — you can stand and walk, or choose a more comfortable way to walk it.

textCN: 人生是拿來體驗的，不一定要拿來完美。
textEN: Life is meant to be experienced — it doesn't need to be perfect.

textCN: 我們應該要做好接受任何結果的準備。
textEN: We should be prepared to accept any outcome.

textCN: 想活成怎樣的自己，只有你自己能夠決定。
textEN: Only you can decide what kind of person you want to become.

textCN: 覺得很煩躁的時候，可以去看大自然。當感覺自己渺小的時候，就會感到心曠神怡。
textEN: When you feel irritated, go look at nature. When you feel your own smallness, you'll feel a refreshing sense of relief.

textCN: 別人在背後說你壞話，有可能你是個萬人迷，也有可能是因為你走在他們前面。
textEN: If people talk badly about you behind your back, it might mean you're charming — or that you're ahead of them.

textCN: 想要的東西就自己去爭取，你不再是個嗷嗷待哺的小孩了。
textEN: Go after the things you want — you're no longer a child waiting to be fed.

textCN: 這世界上有兩種事：不關我的事及不關你的事。
textEN: In this world, there are two kinds of matters: those that don't concern me, and those that don't concern you.

textCN: 人生像是一班列車，每個階段上車的人都不一樣：有的可以陪你到終點站，有的則會在幾站就下車了，所以珍惜在車上的時間吧。
textEN: Life is like a train — the people who get on at each phase are different. Some will stay with you until the final stop, and some will get off after just a few stations. So cherish the time shared on the train.

textCN: 先愛自己，才能愛別人。
textEN: Love yourself first — only then can you love others.

textCN: 好運跟厄運本來就各佔50%，不需要刻意放大不開心的事情。
textEN: Good luck and bad luck are each naturally 50% — there's no need to magnify unhappy things.

textCN: 對在乎的人及在乎你的人好就可以了。
textEN: Just be good to the people you care about, and the people who care about you.

textCN: 過去的事情可以放在心裡收好，沒必要一直帶著走。
textEN: You can store your past carefully in your heart — there's no need to carry it around forever.

textCN: 對自己誠實，不要連自己都要騙。
textEN: Be honest with yourself — don't lie even to your own heart.

textCN: 有些事情需要開始做才會有進展，不是等準備好了才開始。
textEN: Some things only make progress after you begin — don't wait until you think you're fully ready.

textCN: 我們的時間很寶貴，不要浪費在不重要的人身上。
textEN: Our time is precious — don't waste it on people who don't matter.

textCN: 當所有人都在反對你的時候，請你不要連自己都責怪。
textEN: When everyone is against you, please don't blame yourself too.

textCN: 有些事情是沒有答案的，不要太過於執著，那樣會很累。
textEN: Some things simply have no answers — don't cling too tightly, or you'll exhaust yourself.

textCN: 沒有什麽東西是永恆不變的，唯一不變的東西就是改變本身。
textEN: Nothing is truly permanent — the only thing that never changes is change itself.

textCN: 無論你做的再好，總會有人討厭你。你要做的不是討好他們，而是把重心放在那些支持你的人。
textEN: No matter how well you do, there will always be people who dislike you. What you should do is not please them, but put your focus on those who support you.

textCN: 不要只是數著日子過，試著讓每一天都有意義吧。
textEN: Don't count the day, make the days count.

textCN: 保持善良，那不需要花你半毛錢。
textEN: Be kind. It costs nothing.

textCN: 處在不適合的群體，不是想著要怎麽變成像他們一樣，而是去尋找下一個更合適的群體。
textEN: When you're in a group that doesn't suit you, don't think about becoming like them — instead, look for a group that fits you better.

textCN: 你做的每一個決定都需要承擔它所帶來的後果，做之前請三思。
textEN: Every decision you make comes with consequences — think carefully before you act.

textCN: 我們很常預設別人會怎麽看我們，但有時候事實並不像我們想的那樣，放輕鬆。
textEN: We often assume how others will see us, but reality isn't always what we imagine — relax.

textCN: 人的付出具有稀缺性，越稀少越珍貴，付出的同時注意別讓自己掉價了。
textEN: What you give has scarcity — the rarer it is, the more valuable it becomes. While giving, make sure you don't devalue yourself.

textCN: 我們不需要每天都很正向，請允許自己擁有各式各樣的情緒。
textEN: We don't need to be positive every day — allow yourself to have all kinds of emotions.

textCN: 情緒平復、獲得能量之後，接下來應該要找尋實際的解決方法，而不是停留於此。
textEN: After calming down and rebuilding your energy, you should seek actual solutions — don't stay stuck at the emotional stage.

textCN: 人生本來就是不公平的。
textEN: Life is inherently unfair. If you want fair, then go funfair.

textCN: 有誤解就要說出來，沒有人會讀心術。
textEN: If there's misunderstanding, speak it out — no one can read minds.

textCN: 多出門曬點太陽，就不會覺得自己是溫室裡的爛草莓，被兇一下就玻璃心碎。
textEN: Go outside and get more sunlight — you won't feel like a fragile greenhouse strawberry that shatters emotionally the moment someone scolds you.

textCN: 記錄一天中認為開心或幸運的事情，這一天過得也不算太糟。
textEN: Record the things that made you happy or lucky today — then the day won't feel so bad after all.

textCN: 對待重要的人事物，要用心。
textEN: Treat the people and things that matter with heart.

textCN: 每個人的想法都是獨一無二的，也正因為如此，我們必須要站在對方的角度才能看清事情的全貌。
textEN: Everyone's thoughts are unique — and because of that, we must learn to stand in others' shoes to see the full picture.

textCN: 改變自己比改變別人還要容易。
textEN: Changing yourself is easier than changing others.

textCN: 你可以不認同對方，但起碼要尊重。
textEN: You don't have to agree with someone, but at the very least, show respect.

textCN: 道歉是承認自己的錯誤，而不是索取他人的原諒。
textEN: An apology is acknowledging your own mistake — not demanding forgiveness from others.

textCN: 感激他人的付出，因為大家的時間都很寶貴。
textEN: Be grateful for others' efforts — because everyone's time is valuable.

textCN: 很私人的煩惱，傾訴給幾個人知道就好，沒有必要告知天下。
textEN: Private worries only need to be shared with a few close people — there's no need to announce them to the world.

textCN: 如果你身邊有沒事也會想起你的朋友，請你好好珍惜這樣的人。
textEN: If you have friends who think of you even when nothing is happening, treasure them well.

textCN: 來日方長，美好的事情需要等待。
textEN: Good days are long ahead — beautiful things take time to arrive.

textCN: 我們不能期待計劃能完美實現，有時候會趕不上變化，所以隨機應變的能力挺重要的。
textEN: We can't expect every plan to unfold perfectly. Sometimes reality changes faster than we expect, so adaptability is really important.

textCN: 把你身邊的人都當成一面鏡子，他們會是你人生參照及調整的對象。
textEN: Treat the people around you as mirrors — they become the references and adjustments of your life.

textCN: 强者從不抱怨環境，是金子總會發光，你其實沒那麽多藉口。
textEN: The strong never complain about their environment — if you're gold, you will shine. You actually don't have that many excuses.

textCN: 人非聖賢，孰能無過。對他人好一點，不要那麽刻薄，因為你也會有犯錯的時候。
textEN: People are not saints — everyone makes mistakes. Be kinder to others; don't be so harsh, because you too will make mistakes.

textCN: 時間不會沖淡一切，學會跟過去的自己和解，正視自己的內心感受。
textEN: Time doesn't erase everything — learn to reconcile with your past self and face your real feelings.

textCN: 人比人是比不完的，要比就跟自己比。
textEN: Comparing yourself to others never ends — if you must compare, compare with your past self.

textCN: 轉念是個神奇的東西，有時候根深蒂固的念頭轉一下事情就順了。
textEN: A shift in thought is a magical thing — sometimes when a deeply rooted mindset switches, everything starts to flow.

textCN: 別去猜測對方的想法，你永遠得不到一個正確答案，甚至他可能也不清楚自己在想什麽。
textEN: Don't assume you can guess what others are thinking — you'll never get a fully correct answer, and sometimes they themselves don't even know what they're thinking.

textCN: 如果你對某件事情有很高的期待，請同時也要做好事情不如預期的準備。
textEN: If you have high expectations for something, you should also be prepared for the outcome to fall short.

textCN: 有種藝術不是藝術家也可以學會，叫說話的藝術。
textEN: There's a kind of art that even non-artists can learn — the art of speaking.

textCN: 愛要及時，因為你無法預測你愛的人什麽時候會離開你。
textEN: Love needs to be timely, because you never know when the person you love might leave you.

textCN: 時刻培養我們的韌性，在面對挫折的時候才不會一折就斷。
textEN: Keep building your resilience, so you won't break easily when you face setbacks.

textCN: 很多東西講求剛剛好。太多不好，太少也不好，剛剛好就好。
textEN: Many things are about just right. Too much is bad, too little is bad — just right is best.

textCN: 當出現一個質疑的聲音時，那有可能是某人的主觀意見，可以不予理會。但這種聲音開始變多的時候，就需要審視一下自己了。
textEN: When there's only one voice of doubt, it could just be someone's subjective opinion — you can ignore it. But when those voices start increasing, that's when you should re-examine yourself.

textCN: 登高才能望遠，目光放遠一點，格局打開一點，不要局限在眼前的利益。
textEN: You can see farther only when you stand higher. Broaden your perspective; don't be limited by short-term gains.

textCN: 別人是別人，而你是你。你在過你的人生，不是別人的。
textEN: Others are others, and you are you. You're living your life, not theirs.

textCN: 心情低落時，應該先處理情緒再出發，不要忽略你的感受。
textEN: When you're feeling down, deal with your emotions before moving forward. Don't neglect how you feel.

textCN: 也許有些人只會陪你到某個階段，無論再怎麽緊握也沒用。
textEN: Some people are only meant to accompany you for certain stages in life. No matter how tightly you hold on, it won't change that.

textCN: 參考對象不應該以極端值做標準，因為不是每個人都是祖克柏，輟學一定會成功。
textEN: You shouldn't use extreme cases as your reference points — not everyone is Mark Zuckerberg, and dropping out definitely doesn't guarantee success.

textCN: 真正厲害的人大多是很低調的，他們不會到處告訴別人自己有多厲害。
textEN: People who are truly capable tend to be low-key. They don't need to go around telling others how great they are.

textCN: 多出去走走，看看其他人都在做什麽，避免閉門造車。
textEN: Go out more — see what others are doing — so you won't end up working blindly behind closed doors.

textCN: 有時候我們需要踢到鐵板以後才會銘記於心。
textEN: Sometimes we only truly learn our lesson after we've hit a wall.

textCN: 犯錯哪會可恥？你最好不要犯兩次同樣的錯誤。
textEN: There's nothing shameful about making mistakes. Just don't make the exact same one twice.

textCN: 「我這麽做是為了你好」這句話很爛，因為別人不可能完全知道到底什麽對我們是好，什麽是不好，那只有我們自己知道。
textEN: "I'm doing this for your own good" is such a terrible line — because no one else could ever fully know what's good or bad for us. Only we know that.

textCN: 有些話換個說法會讓對方聽了比較舒服，但其實是同樣的意思，可以達到一樣的效果。
textEN: Sometimes rephrasing the same meaning makes it easier for others to accept — but it can still achieve the same effect.

textCN: 心情可以很糟糕，但對待事物的心態絕不能崩潰。哪怕是崩潰了也不要困在這種感受太久。
textEN: Your mood can be terrible, but your attitude toward life can't collapse. And even if it collapses, don't stay in that feeling for too long.

textCN: 打壓、歧視、看不起別人，不會讓你比較高尚，就只是比較沒修養罷了。
textEN: Putting others down, discriminating, looking down on people — it won't make you more noble; it only makes you less cultivated.

textCN: 做自己跟沒有禮貌只有一線之隔。
textEN: There's a very thin line between being yourself and being disrespectful.

textCN: 進度是可以慢慢累積的，每天一點點總比沒有來得好。
textEN: Progress can be built little by little. A tiny bit every day is still better than none.

textCN: 魔鬼都藏在細節裡，請不要忽略它們。
textEN: The devil is in the details — don't ignore them.

textCN: 你只會看到社群上的人光鮮亮麗的樣子，所以也不需要太羡慕別人的生活。
textEN: What you see on social media is only people's glamorous side, so there's no need to envy their lives too much.

textCN: 勿忘初心，別忘記你為何而開始。
textEN: Don't forget your original intention — remember why you started.

textCN: 學會做人或許是這輩子最大的課題之一。
textEN: Learning how to be a decent human being might be one of the biggest lessons of this lifetime.

textCN: 一言既出，駟馬難追。話在說出去之前請三思。
textEN: Once a word is spoken, it's hard to take back — so think twice before you say it.

textCN: 最卑微的付出不是沒有任何報酬，而是你連一句謝謝都得不到。
textEN: The lowest form of giving isn't the one without reward — it's the one where you don't even get a simple "thank you."

textCN: 遇到不講理的人，繞過他就好了，畢竟吵贏他也不會讓你的戶頭多一萬塊。
textEN: When you meet unreasonable people, just walk around them — even if you win the argument, it won't magically put money into your bank account.

textCN: 勿以善小而不為，勿以惡小而為之。
textEN: Do not stop doing good deeds just because they seem small; do not commit bad deeds just because they seem small.

textCN: 人生沒有那麼多早知道。
textEN: Life doesn't give you that many chances to say "I should've known."

textCN: 沒有做過的事就不需要為它辯解，清者自清。
textEN: If you didn't do something, you don't have to defend yourself — the truth defends itself.

textCN: 你的成就應該由你做過的客觀事實來奠定，而不是靠他人的三言兩語。
textEN: Your achievements should be built upon what you've actually done — not on what others say about you.

textCN: 努力的工作，也要努力的玩。
textEN: Work hard, but play hard too.

textCN: 有些事情其實沒說要原諒，只是覺得算了。
textEN: Sometimes forgiveness isn't really given; it's just deciding to let things go.

textCN: 你應該通過自己的眼睛去認識對方，而不是通過別人的嘴巴。
textEN: You should see people through your own eyes, not through someone else's words.

textCN: 糾結在一個沒辦法控制的事物上只會讓自己更痛苦。
textEN: Obsessing over something you can't control will only make you suffer more.

textCN: 要達成一件事情或一個目標，就要付出相對的代價，天下沒有不勞而獲的事。
textEN: To achieve something, you must pay the price — nothing in this world comes for free.

textCN: 羅馬不是一天建成的，成功也不是一蹴而就的。至於怎樣才叫成功，你可以自己定義。
textEN: Rome wasn't built in a day, and neither is success. As for what counts as "success," you get to define it yourself.

textCN: 大事化小，小事化無。
textEN: Turn big problems into small ones, and small ones into none.

textCN: 可以生氣也可以難過，但記得要在今天把情緒消化完，不要帶到明天。
textEN: It's okay to be angry or sad, but remember to process those emotions today — don't carry them into tomorrow.

textCN: 別人的嘴巴長在他們身上，我們沒辦法決定他人要說什麽，但我們可以決定自己要聽什麽。
textEN: You can't control what others say, but you can choose what to listen to.

textCN: 如果被火燙傷，下次就知道不會碰火，這道理對一段人際關係也一樣。
textEN: If you get burned by fire once, you'll know not to touch it again — the same goes for relationships.

textCN: 希望我們都可以成為我們想成為的大人。
textEN: I hope we can all become the kind of adults we once wanted to be.

textCN: 路不轉人轉，要麼硬是開一條路，要麼換別條路走，總會有方法的。
textEN: When the road doesn't turn, you can — either carve a new path or take another route. There's always a way.

textCN: 每個人身上都有標籤，或多或少。
textEN: Everyone carries labels, more or less.

textCN: 友情是需要花時間維繫的。長時間不聯絡，再熟絡的朋友都會變得生疏。
textEN: Friendship takes effort to maintain. Even the closest friends can grow distant without contact.

textCN: 你所有過往的經驗都會以別的方式回到你身上。
textEN: Every experience you've had will return to you in some form.

textCN: 做不出選擇的時候可以試試看刪去法，你一定知道你不喜歡的東西有哪些。
textEN: When you can't make a choice, try using elimination — you always know what you don't like.

textCN: 有的人只適合當朋友，不適合一起共事。
textEN: Some people are meant to be friends, but not colleagues.

textCN: 錢其實是可以買到幸福的。好吃的一餐、好喝的飲料、好看的電影，都可以帶來幸福感。
textEN: Money can buy happiness — a good meal, a nice drink, a great movie can all bring joy.

textCN: 被稱讚的時候除了說聲謝謝以外，也可以用讚美來回覆對方。
textEN: When someone compliments you, besides saying thank you, you can return the kindness with a compliment of your own.

textCN: 積點口德，因果報應這東西是很玄的。
textEN: Watch your words — karma is mysterious in its own way.

textCN: 在對的關係階段裡做那個階段該做的事，不要越界。
textEN: Do what's appropriate for the stage of the relationship you're in; don't overstep the line.

textCN: 努力之後給自己充足的休息跟犒賞吧，那是為了走更長遠的路。
textEN: After working hard, give yourself enough rest and reward — it's so you can go farther.

textCN: 讓人感動流淚的電影，往往不是因為拍的有多好，剪的有多精湛，而是我們從電影裡看到了自己——我們是在看自己的故事。
textEN: Movies that move us to tears aren't necessarily well-made or perfectly edited; it's because we see ourselves in them — we're really watching our own story.

textCN: 天外有天，人外有人。拿捏自信的程度，別太多，也別太少。
textEN: There's always someone better out there. Keep your confidence in check — not too much, not too little.

textCN: 獲得能量或療癒的方法千百種，找到適合自己的方法很重要，你不一定要學別人的。
textEN: There are countless ways to recharge or heal. What matters most is finding the one that works for you — you don't have to copy others.

textCN: 沒那麽大的頭還是不要戴那麽大的帽子，因為這樣會看不到前方的路。
textEN: Don't wear a hat too big for your head — you'll just block your view of the road ahead.

textCN: 現實哪有那麽浮誇，我們又不是在演偶像劇。
textEN: Reality isn't that dramatic; we're not living in a TV drama.

textCN: 大數據下的結果僅供參考。
textEN: Results from big data are for reference only.

textCN: 人生不就是會起起落落落落落的嗎？
textEN: Isn't life just full of ups and downs… and more downs?

textCN: 對傾聽的人來說，安撫好他的情緒，再給建議，他比較能聽得進去。對傾訴的人來說，感謝他願意花時間聽你吐苦水，稍微說教也請忍耐一下。
textEN: For someone who's listening, soothe their emotions first — they'll take your advice better. For someone who's venting, be grateful they're willing to hear you out — and try to tolerate a bit of lecturing.

textCN: 練習可以使你更趨近於完美。
textEN: Practice brings you closer to perfection.

textCN: 因為把你放在心上，所以記得你、在乎你、關心你。
textEN: Because you hold someone in your heart, you remember them, care about them, and think about them.

textCN: 學會看人臉色、讀空氣，這些技能還挺有用的。
textEN: Learning to read expressions and "read the room" is actually a pretty useful skill.

textCN: 我們真的很難理解某個人的痛楚或處境。
textEN: It's truly hard for us to fully understand another person's pain or situation.

textCN: 打鐵需要趁熱，有些事情熱度過了就沒意思了。
textEN: Strike while the iron is hot — once the momentum fades, the meaning fades too.

textCN: 不要把快樂建立在別人的痛苦之上，除非他犯下了什麽滔天大罪。
textEN: Don't build your happiness on someone else's suffering, unless they've done something truly unforgivable.

textCN: 慢就會穩，穩就會快。
textEN: Slow makes steady, and steady makes fast.

textCN: 小時候的快樂很簡單，長大後的簡單是快樂。
textEN: Joy was simple when we were kids; when we grow up, simplicity becomes joy.

textCN: 別只是一味地努力，我們可以聰明地努力。
textEN: Don't just work hard — work smart.

textCN: 光說沒用，行動是真。畫了大餅又不實現，久而久之會讓人覺得印象很差，至於有沒有本事又是一回事。
textEN: Talking means nothing; actions are what matter. Big promises without results only hurt your credibility. Whether you're capable is a separate issue.

textCN: 每個人都有他們各自的課題需要面對。
textEN: Everyone has their own lessons to deal with.

textCN: 讀書很好啊，但更好的是你有學以致用。
textEN: Studying is good, but applying what you learn is even better.

textCN: 知道什麽東西對自己來說是需要，什麽是想要。資源有限，要好好分配。
textEN: Know what you need and what you simply want. Resources are limited—use them wisely.

textCN: 你行你上。那麽會打嘴砲，可以考慮當個辯論選手。
textEN: If you think you can do better, go ahead. If you're that good at talking, maybe join a debate team.

textCN: 沒有人生來就適合彼此。兩個人相處是需要磨合的，把彼此的棱角磨成適合的樣子。
textEN: No one is naturally a perfect match. Relationships take adjustment—smoothing each other's edges until they fit.

textCN: 多觀察和認識自己跟你身邊的人，取他們的長處來補自己的短處。
textEN: Observe yourself and the people around you. Learn from their strengths to fill your gaps.

textCN: 培養自己的媒體識讀能力，不要網路上的人說什麽就信什麽。
textEN: Build your media literacy. Don't believe everything you see online.

textCN: 很多時候我們都會知道其實以後的自己會覺得現在的難關沒什麽，但就是想好好沉浸在當下的感受上啊。
textEN: We often know our future self will look back and think today's struggles weren't a big deal, but sometimes you just want to feel your feelings fully.

textCN: 在還沒學會走之前，先學會爬，而不是學怎麽飛。
textEN: Learn to crawl before you walk, not before you try to fly.

textCN: 將心比心，你怎麽對待別人，別人就怎麽對待你。
textEN: Treat others the way you want to be treated; people usually reflect what you give.

textCN: 無論再怎麽難過，肚子餓了還是要吃，感覺累了還是要睡——生活還是要過。
textEN: No matter how sad you are, you still need to eat when you're hungry and sleep when you're tired—life goes on.

textCN: 面對自己的問題，然後改善它，別太自我感覺良好，你又不是阿Q。
textEN: Face your problems and fix them. Don't get too self-satisfied; you're not Ah Q.

textCN: 人都喜歡看美的事物，這世上有誰不是外貌協會？花點時間整理自己的外在形象也沒什麼，但別太超過了。
textEN: Everyone likes beautiful things—who isn't superficial to some degree? It's fine to tidy up your appearance, just don't overdo it.

textCN: 一回生，二回熟，多做幾次就會游刃有餘了，所以不要害怕第一次做的不好。
textEN: Everything feels strange the first time, but it gets easier the more you do it. Don't fear doing something poorly at the beginning.

textCN: 對你想過的生活有點想像吧！若不符合理想生活的方向，自然就會想要調整了。
textEN: Imagine the life you want. When reality doesn't match that direction, you'll naturally want to adjust.

textCN: 有時候兩個人對於彼此的關係其實不在同一個水平上，那也是很正常的，別太在意對方沒有把我們看得像我們看他那般重要。
textEN: Sometimes two people simply see the relationship on different levels—and that's normal. Don't take it too personally if they don't value you the way you value them.

textCN: 有些事情沒試過就不會知道，只會停留在我們的想像，除了犯法的事情。
textEN: Never try, never know—unless it's illegal.

textCN: 生活不止需要吃飯睡覺，有時候還需要詩和遠方。
textEN: Life isn't just about eating and sleeping; sometimes you need poetry and the distant horizon.

textCN: 不要將你對別人的氣出在另外一個不相關的人上，很莫名其妙也很令人受傷。
textEN: Don't take your anger at one person out on someone else. It's unfair, confusing, and hurtful.

textCN: 做你該做的事，你的節奏不要輕易地被外界打亂。
textEN: Do what you need to do, and don't let the outside world throw off your rhythm.

textCN: 當你正在對未來籌備及規劃時，記得活在當下也同樣重要。
textEN: While planning and preparing for the future, don't forget that living in the present matters just as much.

textCN: 將一個大目標拆分成好幾個小目標，逐個擊破，這樣才不會覺得目標遙不可及。
textEN: Break a big goal into smaller ones and tackle them one by one — that's how it stops feeling out of reach.

textCN: 為自己的言論負責，講了就不要怕承認。
textEN: Stand by your words. If you said it, don't be afraid to own it.

textCN: 如果可以，多跟別人面對面交流，感受平時用社群平台所得不到的東西。
textEN: Whenever you can, talk to people face-to-face. You'll feel things you can't get from social media.

textCN: 學習應該是自發性且永無止境的。
textEN: Learning should be self-driven — and never-ending.

textCN: 您就大人有大量，別跟他們一般計較。
textEN: Be the bigger person; don't bother stooping to their level.

textCN: 及時止損何嘗不是一種解決方法呢？
textEN: Sometimes cutting your losses is one of the ways to deal with it.

textCN: 有時候可以學學周敦頤——出淤泥而不染，你不一定要同流合污。
textEN: Take a page from Zhou Dunyi — stay clean even in the mud; you don't have to follow the crowd.

textCN: 你是永遠叫不醒裝睡的人的。
textEN: You can never wake up someone who's pretending to sleep.

textCN: 做個懂得感恩，飲水思源的人，不要覺得別人的付出是理所當然的。
textEN: Be someone who knows how to be grateful. Never assume other people's efforts are owed to you.

textCN: 滿分十分的話，三分天注定，六分靠打拼，還有一分要靠運氣。
textEN: If life were scored out of ten, three would be fate, six would be hard work, and the last one would be luck.

textCN: 希望你在沒人看見的時候也能持續地發光發熱。
textEN: I hope you can keep shining even when no one's watching.

textCN: 對你好是因為我很好，而不是我被大家評價是個好人。
textEN: I'm good to you because I am a good person—not because people label me as one.

textCN: 別想太多，有的時候心思不那麽細膩也行。
textEN: Don't overthink everything. It's okay if your mind isn't always so delicate and precise.

textCN: 在家靠父母，出外靠朋友。人脈很重要，多擴展你的交友圈。
textEN: At home you rely on your parents; once you step outside, you rely on your friends. Connections matter, so keep expanding your circle.

textCN: 分享即是關懷。
textEN: Sharing is caring.

textCN: 沒有消息也可以是一種好消息。
textEN: No news is good news — sometimes silence simply means nothing's wrong.

textCN: 人不可貌相，一個人的內心跟表面搞不好天差地遠，也不要輕易去批判某些你沒有深入了解的事情。
textEN: Don't judge a book by its cover — someone's surface may look nothing like who they truly are, so avoid jumping to conclusions about things you barely know.

textCN: 有想做的事情就去做吧，不要留有遺憾。有時候感到遺憾是因為沒做，而不是做了卻不滿意。
textEN: If there's something you want to do, go for it. Regret often comes from not trying, not from trying and falling short.

textCN: 跌倒了可以躺著休息一下，躺夠了就站起來。
textEN: If you fall, it's okay to lie down and rest for a bit. Once you've rested enough, stand back up.

textCN: 也許只有真正離開家，才會真的懂得家的美好。在外奔波也記得多回家看看。
textEN: Maybe you only truly understand the beauty of home once you've left it. Even while chasing life outside, remember to go home when you can.

textCN: 哎呀不需要那麽勵志啦，盧廣仲的《勵志論》都沒那麽勵志。
textEN: Come on, it doesn't need to be that inspirational — even Crowd Lu's "C'MON" isn't that inspiring.

textCN: 自己就是最好的投資，這一點準沒錯的。
textEN: Investing in yourself is always the best investment. That part never fails.

textCN: 做個打不死的小强，在接下來的日子也要披荊斬棘。
textEN: Be a little cockroach that refuses to die — keep pushing forward and cutting through the brambles ahead.

textCN: 多讀一點書，多吸取一點知識，只為了讓自己可以有選擇。
textEN: Read more and absorb more knowledge, if only to give yourself more choices in life.

textCN: 設一個你可以達成的目標。不要設一個根本無法達成的，然後沒實現就覺得很糟，那不是自討苦吃嗎？
textEN: Set a goal you can actually reach. Don't pick an impossible one and then feel terrible when you can't achieve it — that's just asking for trouble.

textCN: 有時候身在廬山不知廬山的真面目，還需要旁人多加提點才會恍然大悟。
textEN: Sometimes you can't see the full picture from where you're standing. You need someone else to point things out before everything suddenly makes sense.

textCN: 有的事情是沒辦法一個人幹完的，所以培養團隊合作的能力吧，不要排斥跟別人合作。
textEN: Some things just can't be done alone. Build your ability to work with others, and don't shy away from collaboration.

textCN: 健康最重要，活著才能做更多想做的事、體驗想體驗的人生。
textEN: Health comes first. Only when you're alive and well can you do what you want, and experience the life you hope to live.

textCN: 當身邊的人遇到困難的時候，選擇給予他們幫助而不是落井下石，畢竟也無冤無仇啊。
textEN: When people around you are struggling, choose to help rather than kick them when they're down—you've got no feud with them anyway.

textCN: 每個人的綻放期都不一樣，你不一定會比別人慢，時間到了自然會盛開。
textEN: Everyone blooms at their own pace. You're not necessarily behind; when the time is right, you'll flourish too.

textCN: 你的言行舉止基本上就決定了你是個怎樣的人。
textEN: Your words and actions basically define the kind of person you are.

textCN: 在面對自己的問題時，需要將自己脫離出來，站在更高的角度看整件事情。
textEN: When facing your own problems, try stepping outside yourself and look at the whole situation from a higher perspective.

textCN: 機會是留給有準備的人。保持個準備好的狀態，機會來了也請認出它、爭取它。
textEN: Opportunity favors the prepared. Stay ready, and when a chance comes, recognize it and go for it.

textCN: 天涯何處無芳草，何必單戀一隻花。這又不是只有一個選擇，放過對方，也放過自己。
textEN: There are plenty of flowers in the world—no need to obsess over just one. Let them go, and free yourself too.

textCN: 有輸入才會有產出。想要言之有物，還得多看多讀多聽，豐富自己的資料庫。
textEN: Output depends on input. If you want something meaningful to say, you need to read, listen, and absorb more to enrich your inner library.

textCN: 無心插柳柳成蔭，有時候不經意做的事情往往都會有意想不到的結果發生。
textEN: Sometimes unexpected results come from things you did without intention—serendipity happens.

textCN: 創建一個共贏的局面，帶來的價值絕對大於彼此之間爭個你死我活。
textEN: Creating a win–win situation brings far more value than fighting to the bitter end.

textCN: 對自己的專業領域還是要謙虛，即便你有好幾把刷子，也不要覺得自己已經到達了巔峰。
textEN: Stay humble in your own field. Even if you're good, don't assume you've already reached the peak.

textCN: 一切都是最好的安排。
textEN: Everything happens for the best.

textCN: 一般情況下，沒有人有義務服侍我們，又不是王子或公主。
textEN: In most situations, no one is obligated to serve us—we're not princes or princesses.

textCN: 兩個人的關係應該是要互相且平等的。
textEN: A relationship should be mutual and equal.

textCN: 塞翁失馬焉知非福，有時候壞事發生也伴隨一些意想不到的好事。
textEN: A setback may turn out to be a blessing in disguise; bad things sometimes come with unexpected good.

textCN: 找個你欣賞的人當作榜樣，向他學習吧！
textEN: Find someone you admire, take them as a role model, and learn from them.

textCN: 有時候不知道很多事情也可以是一種幸福。
textEN: Sometimes, not knowing too much can also be a kind of happiness.

textCN: 朋友獲得了自己比較想要的職位，應該替他感到高興。何必為了那一點名利去破壞兩人之間的友情？
textEN: If a friend gets the position they really wanted, be happy for them—why ruin a friendship over a bit of fame or gain?

textCN: 否極泰來，相信在最低谷的時候，就是轉機的開始。
textEN: After hitting rock bottom, things can only go up; the lowest point may be the beginning of a turning point.

textCN: 兩個人之間有那麽多話題可以聊，我們沒有必要說他人的是非。
textEN: There are so many things two people can talk about—there's no need to gossip about others.

textCN: 當一個人完全被遺忘的時候，他才算是真正的死亡。
textEN: A person truly dies only when they are completely forgotten.
